00001 /**
00002  * \file MPFRNormalK.hpp
00003  * \brief Header for MPFRNormalK
00004  *
00005  * Sampling exactly from the normal distribution for MPFR.
00006  *
00007  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2012) <charles@karney.com> and licensed under
00008  * the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00009  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00010  **********************************************************************/
00011 
00012 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_MPFRNORMALK_HPP)
00013 #define RANDOMLIB_MPFRNORMALK_HPP \
00014   "$Id: a512196382fe6e7a2765ae0b88ff414df2940619 $"
00015 
00016 #include <algorithm>            // for max
00017 #include <RandomLib/MPFRRandom.hpp>
00018 #include <RandomLib/MPFRExponential.hpp>
00019 
00020 namespace RandomLib {
00021 
00022   /**
00023    * \brief The normal distribution for MPFR (Kahn algorithm).
00024    *
00025    * This class is <b>DEPRECATED</b>.  It is included for illustrative purposes
00026    * only.  The MPFRNormal class provides a somewhat more efficient method for
00027    * sampling from the normal distribution.
00028    *
00029    * Refs:
00030    * - H. Kahn, Rand Report RM-1237-AEC, p. 41 (1954).
00031    * - M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, p. 953, Sec. 26.8.6.a(4) (1964).
00032    * .
00033    * N.B. Damien Stehle' drew my attention to this algorithm as a useful way to
00034    * compute normal deviates exactly.
00035    *
00036    * This class uses mutable private objects.  So a single MPFRNormalK object
00037    * cannot safely be used by multiple threads.  In a multi-processing
00038    * environment, each thread should use a thread-specific MPFRNormalK object.
00039    *
00040    * @tparam bits the number of bits in each digit.
00041    **********************************************************************/
00042   template<int bits = 32> class MPFRNormalK {
00043   public:
00044 
00045     /**
00046      * Initialize the MPFRNormalK object.
00047      **********************************************************************/
00048     MPFRNormalK()
00049     { mpfr_init2(_xf, MPFR_PREC_MIN); mpfr_init2(_zf, MPFR_PREC_MIN); }
00050     /**
00051      * Destroy the MPFRNormalK object.
00052      **********************************************************************/
00053     ~MPFRNormalK()
00054     { mpfr_clear(_zf); mpfr_clear(_xf); }
00055     /**
00056      * Sample from the normal distribution with mean 0 and variance 1 returning
00057      * a MPFRRandom.
00058      *
00059      * @param[out] t the MPFRRandom result.
00060      * @param[in,out] r a GMP random generator.
00061      **********************************************************************/
00062     void operator()(MPFRRandom<bits>& t, gmp_randstate_t r) const
00063     { Compute(r); _x.swap(t); }
00064     /**
00065      * Sample from the normal distribution with mean 0 and variance 1.
00066      *
00067      * @param[out] val the sample from the normal distribution
00068      * @param[in,out] r a GMP random generator.
00069      * @param[in] round the rounding direction.
00070      * @return the MPFR ternary result (+1/-1 if val is larger/smaller than the
00071      *   exact sample).
00072      **********************************************************************/
00073     int operator()(mpfr_t val, gmp_randstate_t r, mpfr_rnd_t round) const
00074     { Compute(r); return _x(val, r, round); }
00075   private:
00076     // disable copy constructor and assignment operator
00077     MPFRNormalK(const MPFRNormalK&);
00078     MPFRNormalK& operator=(const MPFRNormalK&);
00079     void Compute(gmp_randstate_t r) const {
00080       // The algorithm is sample x and z from the exponential distribution; if
00081       // (x-1)^2 < 2*z, return (random sign)*x; otherwise repeat.  Probability
00082       // of acceptance is sqrt(pi/2) * exp(-1/2) = 0.7602.
00083       while (true) {
00084         _edist(_x, r);
00085         _edist(_z, r);
00086         for (mp_size_t k = 1; ; ++k) {
00087           _x.ExpandTo(r, k - 1);
00088           _z.ExpandTo(r, k - 1);
00089           mpfr_prec_t prec = std::max(mpfr_prec_t(MPFR_PREC_MIN), k * bits);
00090           mpfr_set_prec(_xf, prec);
00091           mpfr_set_prec(_zf, prec);
00092           // Try for acceptance first; so compute upper limit on (y-1)^2 and
00093           // lower limit on 2*z.
00094           if (_x.UInteger() == 0) {
00095             _x(_xf, MPFR_RNDD);
00096             mpfr_ui_sub(_xf, 1u, _xf, MPFR_RNDU);
00097           } else {
00098             _x(_xf, MPFR_RNDU);
00099             mpfr_sub_ui(_xf, _xf, 1u, MPFR_RNDU);
00100           }
00101           mpfr_sqr(_xf, _xf, MPFR_RNDU);
00102           _z(_zf, MPFR_RNDD);
00103           mpfr_mul_2ui(_zf, _zf, 1u, MPFR_RNDD);
00104           if (mpfr_cmp(_xf, _zf) < 0) {    // (y-1)^2 < 2*z, so accept
00105             if (_x.Boolean(r)) _x.Negate(); // include a random sign
00106             return;
00107           }
00108           // Try for rejection; so compute lower limit on (y-1)^2 and upper
00109           // limit on 2*z.
00110           if (_x.UInteger() == 0) {
00111             _x(_xf, MPFR_RNDU);
00112             mpfr_ui_sub(_xf, 1u, _xf, MPFR_RNDD);
00113           } else {
00114             _x(_xf, MPFR_RNDD);
00115             mpfr_sub_ui(_xf, _xf, 1u, MPFR_RNDD);
00116           }
00117           mpfr_sqr(_xf, _xf, MPFR_RNDD);
00118           _z(_zf, MPFR_RNDU);
00119           mpfr_mul_2ui(_zf, _zf, 1u, MPFR_RNDU);
00120           if (mpfr_cmp(_xf, _zf) > 0) // (y-1)^2 > 2*z, so reject
00121             break;
00122           // Otherwise repeat with more precision
00123         }
00124         // Reject and start over with a new y and z
00125       }
00126     }
00127     mutable MPFRRandom<bits> _x;
00128     mutable MPFRRandom<bits> _z;
00129     mutable mpfr_t _xf;
00130     mutable mpfr_t _zf;
00131     const MPFRExponential<bits> _edist;
00132   };
00133 
00134 } // namespace RandomLib
00135 
00136 #endif  // RANDOMLIB_MPFRNORMALK_HPP
